metadata.title: CVE-2017-7277 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The TCP stack in the Linux kernel through 4.10.6 mishandles theSCM_TIMESTAMPING_OPT_STATS feature, which allows local users to obtainsensitive information from the kernel's internal socket data structures orcause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via crafted system calls,related to net/core/skbuff.c and net/socket.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7277` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic-lpae - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-lowlatency - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
